alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 9:21PM CST until January 26 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Mud Creek Near Jacksonville affecting Rusk, Cherokee, Smith and Nacogdoches Counties. For the Mud Creek...including Jacksonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mud Creek near Jacksonville. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding of timber resources along with some farmland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 9.2 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 05/12/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 930 PM CST.
